metadata.Title: CVE-2019-14876 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
In the __lshift function of the newlib libc library, all versions prior to3.3.0 (see newlib/libc/stdlib/mprec.c), Balloc is used to allocate a biginteger, however no check is performed to verify if the allocationsucceeded or not. The access to b1 will trigger a null pointer dereferencebug in case of a memory allocation failure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-14876` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnewlib-arm-none-eabi - 3.3.0-0ubuntu1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: newlib package in esm-apps/focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.3.0-0ubuntu1').
